common

Class ImageRandomAccessReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.ImageRandomAccessReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteStreamReader, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class ImageRandomAccessReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements ByteStreamReader
    Utility for reading binary data from image files with configurable byte order.

    This class wraps a RandomAccessFile for efficient, reliable seeking (seek, skip, mark/reset stack) and provides methods to read signed and unsigned values of various primitive types. It supports both big-endian and little-endian formats.

    Unlike standard input streams, this class maintains a stack of marked positions, allowing for nested "diving" into sub-structures and returning to previous offsets in LIFO order.

    Since:
    12 December 2025
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      ImageRandomAccessReader(java.nio.file.Path fpath)

      ImageRandomAccessReader(java.nio.file.Path fpath, java.nio.ByteOrder order)
      Constructs a reader for the specified file path, respecting the byte order.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageRandomAccessReader

        public ImageRandomAccessReader(java.nio.file.Path fpath,
                               java.nio.ByteOrder order)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a reader for the specified file path, respecting the byte order. This is the primary constructor using RandomAccessFile. Note, this is configured as a read-only operation.
        Parameters:
        fpath - the path to the image file to be read
        order - the byte order used for interpreting multi-byte values
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while opening the file

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when opening the file

      • mark

        public void mark()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Records the current position in the stream by pushing it onto an internal stack. A subsequent call to reset() will pop this position and return the reader to it.
        Specified by:
        mark in interface ByteStreamReader
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while retrieving the file pointer

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Repositions the stream to the last position recorded by the mark() method. This operation removes the position from the internal stack.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface ByteStreamReader
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs during seeking
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the mark stack is empty (no corresponding mark exists)

      • peek

        public byte peek(long offset)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a single byte at the specified offset relative to the current position.

        The file pointer is restored to its original position before this method returns, even if a read error occurs.

        Specified by:
        peek in interface ByteStreamReader
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset relative to the current file pointer
        Returns:
        the byte value at the target position
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs or the target position is invalid

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a null-terminated string (C-style string) from the current position, consuming the null terminator.

        This method scans the file for a null byte (0x00). The file pointer is advanced past both the string data and the null terminator. The returned string is decoded using ISO-8859-1 and does not include the null terminator.

        Specified by:
        readString in interface ByteStreamReader
        Returns:
        the string content without the null terminator
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs or the end of file is reached before finding a null terminator
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the detected string length exceeds Integer.MAX_VALUE

      • readAllBytes

        public byte[] readAllBytes()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the entire contents of the file from the beginning (position 0) to the end of the file.

        This operation is non-advancing: the file pointer is guaranteed to be restored to its original position (the position it held before this method was called) upon successful completion or after an exception is thrown.

        Returns:
        a new byte array containing the entire file content or an empty array if the file is empty
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs during file access or if the file size exceeds the maximum Java array size (2GB)

           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the underlying RandomAccessFile.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Ensures that the requested number of bytes is available within the physical file limits.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.io.EOFException - if the read exceeds the file length
